12389|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0085.wav|||the Commission believes that the liaison between all Federal agencies responsible for Presidential protection should be improved.|
12390|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0086.wav|||Other Protective Measures and Aspects of Secret Service Performance|
12391|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0087.wav|||The President's trip to Dallas called into play many standard operating procedures of the Secret Service in addition to its preventive intelligence operations.|
12392|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0088.wav|||Examination of these procedures shows that in most respects they were well conceived and ably executed by the personnel of the Service.|
12393|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0089.wav|||Against the background of the critical events of November twenty-two, however,|
12394|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0090.wav|||certain shortcomings and lapses from the high standards which the Commission believes should prevail in the field of Presidential protection are evident.|
12395|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0091.wav|||Advance preparations.|
12396|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0092.wav|||The advance preparations in Dallas by Agent Winston G. Lawson of the White House detail have been described in chapter two.|
12397|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0093.wav|||With the assistance of Agent in Charge Sorrels of the Dallas field office of the Secret Service,|
12398|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0094.wav|||Lawson was responsible for working out a great many arrangements for the President's trip.|
12399|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0095.wav|||The Service prefers to have two agents perform advance preparations.|
12400|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0096.wav|||In the case of Dallas, because President Kennedy had scheduled visits to five Texas cities|
12401|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0097.wav|||and had also scheduled visits to other parts of the country immediately before the Texas trip,|
12402|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0098.wav|||there were not enough men available to permit two agents to be assigned to all the advance work.|
12403|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0099.wav|||Agent Lawson did the advance work alone from November thirteen to November eighteen, when he was joined by Agent David B. Grant,|
12404|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0100.wav|||who had just completed advance work on the President's trip to Tampa.|
12405|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0101.wav|||The Commission concludes that the most significant advance arrangements for the President's trip were soundly planned.|
12406|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0102.wav|||In particular, the Commission believes that the motorcade route selected by Agent Lawson, upon the advice of Agent in Charge Sorrels|
12407|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0103.wav|||and with the concurrence of the Dallas police, was entirely appropriate, in view of the known desires of the President.|
12408|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0104.wav|||There were far safer routes via freeways directly to the Trade Mart,|
12409|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0105.wav|||but these routes would not have been in accordance with the White House staff instructions given the Secret Service for a desirable motorcade route.|
12410|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0106.wav|||Much of Lawson's time was taken with establishing adequate security over the motorcade route and at the two places where the President would stop,|
12411|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0107.wav|||Love Field and the Trade Mart.|
12412|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0109.wav|||by these Secret Service agents with the cooperation of the Dallas police and other local law enforcement agents, were carefully executed.|
12413|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0110.wav|||Since the President was to be at the Trade Mart longer than at any other location in Dallas and in view of the security hazards presented by the building,|
12414|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0111.wav|||the Secret Service correctly gave particular attention in the advance preparations to those arrangements.|
12415|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0112.wav|||The Commission also regards the security arrangements worked out by Lawson and Sorrels at Love Field as entirely adequate.|
12416|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0113.wav|||The Commission believes, however,|
12417|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0114.wav|||that the Secret Service has inadequately defined the responsibilities of its advance agents, who have been given broad discretion|
12418|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0115.wav|||to determine what matters require attention in making advance preparations and to decide what action to take.|
12419|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0116.wav|||Agent Lawson was not given written instructions concerning the Dallas trip or advice about any peculiar problems which it might involve;|
12420|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0117.wav|||all instructions from higher authority were communicated to him orally.|
12421|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0118.wav|||He did not have a checklist of the tasks he was expected to accomplish, either by his own efforts or with the cooperation of local authorities.|
12422|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0119.wav|||The only systematic supervision of the activities of the advance agent|
12423|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0120.wav|||has been that provided by a requirement that he file interim and final reports on each advance assignment.|
12424|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0121.wav|||The interim report must be in the hands of the agent supervising the protective group traveling with the President|
12425|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0122.wav|||long enough before his departure to apprise him of any particular problems encountered and the responsive action taken.|
12426|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0123.wav|||Agent Lawson's interim report was received by Agent Kellerman on November twenty, the day before departure on the Texas trip.|
12427|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0124.wav|||The Secret Service has advised the Commission that no unusual precautions were taken for the Dallas trip, and that, quote,|
12428|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0125.wav|||the precautions taken for the President's trip were the usual safeguards employed on trips of this kind in the United States during the previous year, end quote.|
12429|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0126.wav|||Special Agent in Charge Sorrels testified that the advance preparations followed on this occasion were, quote, pretty much the same, end quote,|
12430|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0127.wav|||as those followed in nineteen thirty-six during a trip to Dallas by President Roosevelt,|
12431|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0128.wav|||which was Sorrels' first important assignment in connection with Presidential work.|
12432|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0129.wav|||In view of the constant change in the nature of threats to the President and the diversity of the dangers which may arise in the various cities within the United States,|
12433|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0130.wav|||the Commission believes that standard procedures in use for many years and applied in all parts of the country may not be sufficient.|
12434|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0131.wav|||There is, for example, no Secret Service arrangement for evaluating before a trip particular difficulties that might be anticipated,|
12435|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0132.wav|||which would bring to bear the judgment and experience of members of the White House detail other than the advance agent.|
12436|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0133.wav|||Constant reevaluation of procedures, with attention to special problems and the development of instructions specific to particular trips|
12437|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0134.wav|||would be a desirable innovation.|

12466|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0163.wav|||it has not been the practice of the Secret Service to make surveys or checks of buildings along the route of a Presidential motorcade.|

12468|english|english|LJSpeech-1.1/wavs/LJ048-0165.wav|||buildings along the route can be checked by teams of law enforcement officers, and armed guards are posted along the route as appropriate.|
